seriesJson.title: Egoist in tragedy
seriesJson.description: Three lectures by David Grene, poet, translator, and Professor in the Committee on Social Thought, University of Chicago.  He discusses a particular kind of tragedy and focuses on three examples.

node.title: Ibsen's The Master-Builder, part two
node.description: This program features the conclusion of David Grene's lecture on  Henrik Ibsen's The Master-Builder.

node.title: Ibsen's The Master-Builder, part one
node.description: This program features the first part of David Grene's lecture on  Henrik Ibsen's The Master-Builder.

node.title: Shakespeare: Coriolanus, part two
node.description: This program features the second part of David Grene's lecture on Shakespeare's Coriolanus.

node.title: Shakespeare: Coriolanus, part one
node.description: This program features the first part of David Grene's lecture on Shakespeare's Coriolanus.

node.title: The Philoctetes of Sophocles, part two
node.description: This program features the second part of David Grene's lecture on Sophocles' Philoctetes.

node.title: The Philoctetes of Sophocles, part one
node.description: This program features the first part of David Grene's lecture on Sophocles' Philoctetes.
